lines.text: I was raised to be charming, not sincere.
What's the matter?

Oh, nothing! You just locked me in a tower without company for fourteen years, then you blinded my Prince and banished me to a desert where I had little to eat, and again no company, and then bore twins! Because of the way you treated me, I'll never, never be happy!
[she cries]

[pause]
I was just trying to be a good mother.
Every knot was once straight rope.
You need an objective observer to pass the story along.
Some of us don't like the way you've been telling it.
Near may be better than far, but it still isn't there.
Now it's he and not you who is stuck with the shoe... in a stew... in the goo... and you've learned something too... something you never knew... on the steps of the palace!
Please! I need your shoe to have a child!
Children can be very queer about their animals. You be careful with your children.

[mournfully]
I have no children.
That's okay too.
Giants never strike the same house twice.

[to Cinderella]
You can talk to birds?
I wish...
Into the woods to bring some bread to Granny who is sick in bed. Never can tell what lies ahead - for all that I know, she's already dead.
Into the woods to sell a friend.
Someday, you'll have a real pet, Jack.

[eagerly]
A piggy?
No!
And scarcely had the wolf said this, than with a single bound he was devouring the little girl.
[laughs]
Well, it was a full day of eating for both.
Opportunity is not a lengthy visitor.
You may know what you need, but to get what you want, better see that you keep what you have.
Who are you, old man?

[with a suppressed sigh]
When first I appear, I seem deleterious, but when explained -
Shut up!
[a giant is running around the kingdom]

[to the baker and his wife]
With a giant, We all have to go to battle! A giant's the worst! A giant has a brain. Hard to outwit a giant. A giant's just like us, only bigger. Much, much bigger! So big that we are just an expendable
[sees a bug on the floor]
bug, beneath it's feet.
[steps on the bug and cruelly drives her foot into it]
Boom! Crush!
[eats the bug and leaves]
We are moving!
When going to hide, know how to get there.
And how to get back.
And eat first.
Do you know what you wish? Are you certain what you wish is what you want? If you know what you want, then make a wish.

But then how do you know who you are till you know what you want? Which you don't. So then which do you pick? Where you're safe, out of sight, and yourself, but where everything's wrong? Or where everything's right and you know that you'll never belong? But whichever you pick, do it quick, 'cause you're starting to stick to the steps of the palace!
It takes care, it takes patience and fear and despair to change. Though you swear to change, who can tell if you do? It takes two.
You're so nice. You're not good, you're not bad, you're just nice. I'm not good, I'm not nice, I'm just right. I'm the Witch. You're the world.
Oh if life were made of moments, even now and then a bad one, but if life were made of moments then you'd never know you'd had one.
Rapunzel! Rapunzel! What kind of a name is that?
She went that way. I... I was trying to hold her here for you, but...
I can capture my own damsel, thank you.
I'd have kept those beans, but our house was cursed. She made us get a cow to get the curse reversed!
It's his father's fault that the curse got placed, and the place got cursed in the first place!
A wolf and a person aren't the same thing.
Ask a wolf's mother.
You can talk to birds?
If it weren't for the thicket...
A thicket's no trick, is it thick?
It's the thickest.
The quickest is pick it apart with a stick.
Yes, but even one prick, it's my thing about blood...
Well it's sick.
No sicker than your thing with dwarves.
Dwarfs.
Dwarfs.
Dwarfs are very upsetting.
Always in thrall most to anything, almost, or something asleep.
There's no possible way to describe what you feel... when you're talking to your meal.
Never wear mauve to a ball.
...or pink!
...or open your mouth.

[singing]
He's a very smart Prince, he's a Prince who prepares. Knowing this time I'd run from him He spread pitch on the stairs. I was caught unawares. And I thought "Well, He cares." This is more than just malice! Better take stock while you're standing here stuck on the steps of the palace.
Nice is different than Good.
Life is often so unpleasant, you must know that as a peasant, best to take the moment present as a present for the moment.
...You have a princess.
Yes.
And I... I have a... a baker.
We've no time to sit and dither while her withers wither with her!
Slotted spoons don't hold much soup.
The slotted spoon can catch the potato.

[Prince is "looking" for the giant, and the Baker's Wife is looking for Jack]
Anything can happen in the woods... May I kiss you?
[Baker's Wife gasps]
Any moment we could be crushed!
Uh...
Don't feel rushed.
[He kisses her, she pulls away for just a moment to look at the audience]
This is ridicuous, what am I doing here, I'm in the wrong story!
[goes back to kiss him again]
Did you learn her name?
No there's a dwarf standing guard!

[trying to guess what destroyed the witch's garden]
Do you think it was a bear?
A bear? No, bears are sweet! Besides, you ever see a bear with forty-foot feet?
A dragon?
No scorch marks. Usually they're linked.
Manticore?
Imaginary!
Gryphon?
Extinct.
Giant?

[pauses]
Possible. Very, very possible.
My mother warned me that I'd be severely punished if I were to lose any of the beans!
Beans?
The special beans! I let him go, I didn't know he'd stolen my beans! I was watching him crawl back over the wall when BANG! CRASH! The lighting flashed! And... well, that's another story, nevermind.
We must be gone if we're to arrive before nightfall.
Where are you going?
We're off to a hidden kingdom.
Shhh. We can't take everyone.
Fools! There is nowhere to hide!
You'll never get there. We have to stay and find our way out of this together.
Some people are cut out to battle Giants, and others are not. I don't have the constitution. And as long as I can be of no help, I'm going to hide. Everything will work out fine in the end.
[Cinderella's father, stepmother, stepsisters and the steward exit]
I hope the giant steps on them all.
You shouldn't say that!
You were thinking the same thing.
[upon seeing his wife in the woods, after he has forbidden it]
What are you doing here now?

[ignoring him]
I see you've the red cape!
Yes! Yes, I've the cape! I've only two items left to locate!
Three!
Two! I've the cow and the cape!

[triumphantly]
You've the cape!
[her smile fades, as she has lost the cow...]
Wishes may bring problems, such that you regret them, better that though than to never get them.

[to the giantess]
Would you like a blind girl insread?
How dare you?
Put them out of their misery!
We're not that miserable
If the end is right it justifies the beans.
When first I appear, I seem delirious, but when explained, I'm nothing serious.
When first I appear, I seem deleterious, but when explained, I'm nothing serious.

Careful the things you say, children will listen. Careful the things you do, children will see. And learn. Children may not obey, but children will listen. Children will look to you for which way to turn, to learn what to be. Careful before you say, "Listen to me." Children will listen.

Careful the wish you make, wishes are children. Careful the path they take - wishes come true, not free. Careful the spell you cast, not just on children. Sometimes the spell may last beyond what you can see and turn against you.
Careful the tale you tell. That is the spell. Children will listen.
[Seeing the door to her Granny's cottage open]
Oh dear. How uneasy I feel...

High in her tower she sits by the hour maintaining her hair, blythe and becoming and frequently humming a light-hearted air, ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah-ah Agony! Far more painful than yours, When you know she would go with you, if there only were doors
Agony! Oh the torture they teach
What's as intriguing
Or half so fatiguing
As what's out of reach!
You'd be lucky to exchange her for a sack of beans!
